isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Adjustments - Major Front Wheel Alignment

svcproc.title: Major Front Wheel Alignment
svcproc.para: Perform a major front wheel alignment to correct steering and tire wear conditions.
To perform the major front wheel alignment, refer to the following sequence:

step1.para: Inspect all the systems that affect the wheel alignment. Refer to Inspection Before Alignment in this section.

Check and adjust the wheel bearings. For models with unitized hubs, check wheel bearing end play for the truck hub unit. Refer to Inspection of Sealed Hub Units in LUBRICATION, INSPECTION AND MAINTENANCE Section.
Check and adjust the maximum turn angle.
If the vehicle has power steering, check and adjust the pressure relief in the power steering system.
Check and adjust the turning radius angle (toe-out on turns or Ackerman angle). Refer to Turning Radius Angle in this section.
Check the king pin (or steering axis) inclination. Refer to Steering Axis Inclination in this section.
Check the camber angle. Refer to Camber Angle in this section.

caution.para: Axle camber is not adjustable. Do not change the axle camber angle or bend the axle beam. Bending the axle beam to change the camber angle can damage the axle and reduce axle strength, and will void Meritar's warranty. A bent axle beam can also cause a vehicle accident and serious personal injury.

step1.para: Check and adjust the caster angle. Refer to Caster Angle in this section.
Check and adjust the toe-in. Refer to Adjust the Toe in this section.
